puzzle.body: This annotation has to be on methods returning void only. A compile-time APT processor needs to be created that will verify that only void methods have @Quietly annotations. In runtime it should throw an exception before executing of method body, if its return type is not void.
It's a temporary design, which enables only NotNull, Valid, and Pattern annotations. In the future we should use JSR-303 Validator, when they implement validation of values (see their appendix C).
The test is disabled since in Java final arrays can still be modified (bloody Java!)
